skill.name: chembl-database
skill.description: Query ChEMBL's bioactive molecules and drug discovery data. Search compounds by structure/properties, retrieve bioactivity data (IC50, Ki), find inhibitors, perform SAR studies, for medicinal chemistry.
skill.summary: Query ChEMBL's bioactive molecules and drug discovery data. Search compounds by structure/properties...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or exfiltration patterns were found. Code focuses on ChEMBL client queries and local data handling only.

content.user_title: Query ChEMBL compounds and bioactivity data
content.value_statement: Finding reliable bioactivity data across targets is slow and fragmented. This skill queries ChEMBL by structure, properties, and target to return focused results.
actual_capabilities: Retrieve molecules or targets by ChEMBL ID
Search molecules and targets by name filters
Query bioactivity records by target and activity type
Run similarity and substructure searches with SMILES
limitations: Depends on ChEMBL API availability and rate limits
Does not perform offline bulk downloads
Results rely on ChEMBL data curation quality

use_cases.title: Find potent inhibitors
use_cases.description: Identify compounds with IC50 thresholds for a target and review candidate lists.

use_cases.title: Build target profiles
use_cases.description: Pull target metadata and linked bioactivity measurements for downstream analysis.

use_cases.title: Review known drug data
use_cases.description: Retrieve indications and mechanisms for known drugs to assess repurposing options.

prompt_templates.title: Get molecule by ID
prompt_templates.prompt: Get molecule details for CHEMBL25 and list name, formula, and key properties.

prompt_templates.title: Search by name
prompt_templates.scenario: Find compounds matching a name pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Search molecules with pref_name containing aspirin and return the first 5 ChEMBL IDs.

prompt_templates.title: Find potent activities
prompt_templates.prompt: Find IC50 activities for CHEMBL203 with standard_value under 50 nM.

prompt_templates.title: Structure similarity
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a similarity search for SMILES CC(=O)Oc1ccccc1C(=O)O at 85 percent and summarize top results.

output_examples.input: Find IC50 activities for EGFR and list the top 5 most potent compounds.
output: Retrieved IC50 activities for target CHEMBL203
Filtered to values under the potency threshold
Top compounds include CHEMBL25, CHEMBL120158, and CHEMBL190
Each result includes activity value, units, and assay reference

best_practices: Specify activity type and units when filtering bioactivity results
Use caching and pagination to reduce repeated requests
Validate data with data_validity_comment before analysis
anti_patterns: Requesting large unfiltered result sets without pagination
Assuming all activity values are in the same units
Ignoring target_type when searching for protein targets

faq.question: Which runtimes are compatible?
faq.answer: Python is required with chembl_webresource_client installed.

faq.question: Are there query limits?
faq.answer: ChEMBL applies fair usage limits, so avoid rapid repeated queries.

faq.question: Can I integrate results into pandas?
faq.answer: Yes, the script includes a helper to convert results into a DataFrame.

faq.question: Does this skill access my local secrets?
faq.answer: No, it only uses the ChEMBL client and does not read local credentials.

faq.question: What should I do if queries time out?
faq.answer: Reduce query size, use pagination, and set a longer timeout.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual web searches?
faq.answer: It provides programmatic, filterable access to ChEMBL with reproducible queries.
